current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to use existing authorities to furnish health care at
			 non-Department of Veterans Affairs facilities to veterans who live more
			 than 40 miles driving distance from the closest medical facility of the
			 Department that
			 furnishes the care sought by the veteran.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

header.#text:
Use of existing Department of Veterans Affairs authorities to furnish health care to certain
			 veterans who have geographic inaccessibility to care

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall use the authorities specified in subsection (b) to furnish
			 hospital care and medical services at non-Department of Veterans Affairs
			 facilities to veterans who  reside more than 40 miles driving distance
			 from the closest
			 medical facility of the

to the residence of the veteran that
			 furnishes the hospital care or medical services that are sought by the
			 veteran, including a community-based outpatient clinic.

text.#text: The authorities specified in this subsection are the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, relating to contracts for the furnishing of hospital
			 care and medical services through non-Department facilities.

, relating to the furnishing of
			 hospital care and medical services to veterans through non-Department
			 entities if the veteran is unable to schedule an appointment for the
			 receipt of such care or services within the wait-time goals of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 101 of the Veterans Access, Choice, and Accountability Act of
			 2014
